# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    result = []
    current_width = 0

    for word in words
        if current_width + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(result, word)
            push!(result, "\n")
            current_width = 0
        end
        current_width += length(word) + 1
        if last(result) != "\n"
            push!(result, word)
        end
    end
    return join(result)
end

# Example
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed non risus. Suspendisse nec congue purus."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This `wrap_string` function will wrap the input text into new lines when the text width exceeds the specified `text_width`. The default `text_width` is 10.
